GET /zones/{zone_identifier}/firewall/ua.description: Fetches User Agent Blocking rules in a zone. You can filter the results using several optional parameters.

allOf.description: A string to search for in the description of existing rules.
A string to search for in the description of existing rules.

schema.description: The maximum number of results per page. You can only set the value to `1` or to a multiple of 5 such as `5`, `10`, `15`, or `20`.
A string to search for in the user agent values of existing rules.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

configuration.description: The configuration object for the current rule.

target.description: The configuration target for this rule. You must set the target to `ua` for User Agent Blocking rules.

value.description: The exact user agent string to match. This value will be compared to the received `User-Agent` HTTP header value.
value.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_5) AppleWebKit/603.2.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/10.1.1 Safari/603.2.4

description.description: An informative summary of the rule.
description.example: Prevent access from abusive clients identified by this User Agent to mitigate a DDoS attack

id.description: The unique identifier of the User Agent Blocking rule.

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request.

paused.description: When true, indicates that the rule is currently paused.

POST /zones/{zone_identifier}/firewall/u.description: Creates a new User Agent Blocking rule in a zone.

target.description: The configuration target. You must set the target to `ip` when specifying an IP address in the rule.

value.description: The IP address to match. This address will be compared to the IP address of incoming requests.

target.description: The configuration target. You must set the target to `ip6` when specifying an IPv6 address in the rule.
The configuration target. You must set the target to `ip_range` when specifying an IP address range in the rule.

value.description: The IP address range to match. You can only use prefix lengths `/16` and `/24` for IPv4 ranges, and prefix lengths `/32`, `/48`, and `/64` for IPv6 ranges.

target.description: The configuration target. You must set the target to `asn` when specifying an Autonomous System Number (ASN) in the rule.
The configuration target. You must set the target to `country` when specifying a country code in the rule.

value.description: The two-letter ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 code to match. For more information, refer to [IP Access rules: Parameters](https://developers.cloudflare.com/waf/tools/ip-access-rules/parameters/#country).

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

200.description: Create a User Agent Blocking rule response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Create a User Agent Blocking rule response failure
